title: 107_hr4141
content: The Act titled "Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area Protection and Enhancement Act of 2002" defines key terms like Corporation, Red Rock, Red Rock Map, and Secretary. The Act aims to protect the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area in Clark County, Nevada. The Congress recognizes the significance of Red Rock as a natural resource and the need to protect it for future generations. The Corporation owns land on Red Rock's eastern boundary and is developing a master-planned community, including high-ground lands that were intended to be part of Red Rock. Protecting this acreage would preserve the view-shed of the western Las Vegas Valley. The Corporation has volunteered to forgo development of high-ground lands in the western Las Vegas Valley view-shed. The Act aims to exchange lands between the United States and the Corporation to protect and expand Red Rock as outlined by the Bureau of Land Management. This aligns with the Southern Nevada Public Lands Management Act of 1998 and the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area Establishment Act of 1990. SEC. 4. RED ROCK LAND EXCHANGE. The Red Rock Land Exchange involves the Corporation offering approximately 1,082 acres of nonfederal land to the United States. In return, the Secretary will convey federal lands to the Corporation and Clark County, Nevada. The conveyances must occur simultaneously, and the Red Rock Map will be available for public inspection in Nevada. The Bureau of Land Management in Nevada and the State Office of the Bureau in Reno, Nevada, have conditions for hazardous materials removal and survey requirements for land conveyance. Lands transferred to Clark County must be held in perpetuity. The Bureau of Land Management in Nevada and the State Office of the Bureau in Reno have conditions for hazardous materials removal and survey requirements for land conveyance. Lands transferred to Clark County must be held in perpetuity as a public park or part of a regional trail system, reverting to the United States if used inconsistently. SEC. 5. STATUS AND MANAGEMENT OF LANDS. The Secretary shall administer the Flood Control Detention Basin Lands as part of Red Rock in accordance with relevant laws. Acquired lands will also be administered as part of Red Rock, with new maps reflecting boundary adjustments. The Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area Establishment Act of 1990 is amended to include additional areas as part of the conservation area. The amendment can be reviewed at the Las Vegas District Office and the State Office of the Bureau of Land Management in Nevada. The Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area Establishment Act of 1990 is amended to include additional areas as part of the conservation area. The amendment can be reviewed at the Las Vegas District Office and the State Office of the Bureau of Land Management in Nevada. General provisions are outlined in Section 6. The Secretary will review an appraisal for a land exchange in Las Vegas. The exchange will respect existing rights and allow for technical corrections. The Secretary will withdraw affected lands from public land laws. The Secretary will withdraw Federal lands acquired or owned by the United States under the Act from public land laws. The House of Representatives passed the bill on October 1, 2002.
